inlineContent.text: In Firebase, HTTPS functions and callable functions are two different ways to create and deploy cloud functions. HTTPS functions are invoked via HTTP requests, while callable functions can be invoked using client SDKs with typed parameters and return types, making them easier to use from client-side applications. Additionally, callable functions include built-in security features, such as authentication and authorization, making them more secure than HTTPS functions. With HTTPS functions, developers must implement their own security measures, such as validating the userâ€™s identity and checking for authorized access to the function. However, HTTPS functions offer more flexibility and can be invoked from a wider range of clients, including non-Firebase clients, such as webhooks or third-party services.
